option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"C:/Users/Vazha/IdeaProjects/AudioAnvil":"{\"/frontend/src/components/Songs.js\":\"This file is a React component called `Songs` that fetches and displays a list of songs, allows the user to create new songs, and generate chord progressions for selected songs.\\n\\n`Songs`: A React component that manages the state of songs, new song creation, and chord progression generation.\\n\\n`fetchSongs`: A function that fetches the list of songs from the server using the provided token.\\n\\n`handleCreateSong`: A function that creates a new song on the server and updates the local state.\\n\\n`handleGenerateChords`: A function that generates chord progressions for a selected song and updates the local state.\",\"/frontend/src/components/Navbar.css\":\"This file contains CSS styles for a navbar and a profile dropdown menu. It does not contain any classes or functions. The file defines the styles for the following elements:\\n\\n`.navbar`: Styles the main navigation bar with a gradient background, spacing, and shadow.\\n\\n`.navbar-logo`: Styles the logo in the navbar, including a hover effect.\\n\\n`.navbar-links`: Styles the navigation links in the navbar, including an active state and hover effect.\\n\\n`.profile-dropdown-container`: Styles the container for the profile dropdown menu.\\n\\n`.profile-info`: Styles the profile information, including the profile image and username.\\n\\n`.dropdown-menu`: Styles the dropdown menu that appears when the profile is clicked.\\n\\n`.dropdown-item`: Styles the individual items in the dropdown menu, including a hover effect.\\n\\nThe file also includes responsive design styles for smaller screens and animations for the dropdown menu.\",\"/frontend/src/components/Footer.css\":\"This file contains CSS styles for a website footer. It defines the layout, colors, and typography of the footer. There are no classes or functions defined in this file.\\n\\nThe file does the following:\\n\\n1. Sets the background gradient, text color, and padding for the footer.\\n2. Aligns the content within the footer using flexbox.\\n3. Adds a box shadow to the footer.\\n4. Styles the footer content, including the copyright text and the footer links.\\n5. Defines the hover effect for the footer links.\",\"/backend/firebase.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it sets up a connection to a Firebase Firestore database using the Firebase Admin SDK for Python. The code performs the following steps:\\n\\n1. Imports the necessary modules from the `firebase_admin` and `firebase_admin.credentials` libraries.\\n2. Loads the Firebase configuration credentials from a JSON file located in the `config/firebase_config.json` directory.\\n3. Initializes the Firebase app using the loaded credentials.\\n4. Creates a Firestore client object that can be used to interact with the Firebase Firestore database.\",\"/frontend/README.old.md\":\"There are no classes or functions in the provided file. The file appears to be an empty XML document, which is a markup language used to structure and organize data. Without any content, the file does not perform any specific functionality.\",\"/frontend/src/components/EditLyrics.js\":\"This file contains a React component called `EditLyrics` that allows users to edit and save lyrics. Here\\u0027s a summary of the classes and functions in the file:\\n\\n`EditLyrics`: A React component that provides an interface for editing and saving lyrics, including displaying metadata, handling input changes, saving the lyrics, and canceling the edit.\\n\\n`handleInputChange`: A function that updates the `lyrics` state when the user types in the textarea.\\n\\n`handleSave`: A function that sends a PUT request to the server to save the updated lyrics, and updates the component\\u0027s state accordingly.\\n\\n`handleCancel`: A function that resets the `lyrics` state to the initial value and exits the editing mode.\",\"/frontend/public/index.html\":\"This file is a standard HTML template for a React application. It does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it sets up the basic structure and metadata for a React application, including:\\n\\n- Defining the HTML document structure with `\\u003chtml\\u003e`, `\\u003chead\\u003e`, and `\\u003cbody\\u003e` tags.\\n- Specifying the character encoding, viewport, and theme color for the application.\\n- Providing metadata about the application, such as the description and icons for mobile devices.\\n- Linking to the `manifest.json` file, which provides additional metadata for the application.\\n- Rendering the React application\\u0027s root element with `\\u003cdiv id\\u003d\\\"root\\\"\\u003e\\u003c/div\\u003e`.\\n- Providing instructions for running the development server and creating a production build.\",\"/backend/routes/chords.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`suggest_chords`: This function takes in a key and a mood, and returns a list of chord progressions based on the provided inputs.\\n\\nThe file appears to be a Flask blueprint for handling chord suggestions. It defines a route `/` that accepts a POST request with a `key` and `mood` parameter, and returns a JSON response with a list of chord progressions based on the provided inputs.\",\"/frontend/src/components/Profile.js\":\"This file is a React component that displays a user\\u0027s profile information, allows the user to update their username, email, password, and profile image, and handles the API requests to the backend server.\\n\\n`ProfileImage`: A functional component that renders the user\\u0027s profile image, using a default image if the user\\u0027s profile image is not available.\\n\\n`Profile`: A functional component that renders the user\\u0027s profile information, allows the user to edit and save their username, email, and password, and handles the profile image upload and deletion.\\n\\n`refreshAuthToken`: A function that refreshes the user\\u0027s authentication token by making a POST request to the `/auth/refresh` endpoint.\\n\\n`handleApiRequest`: A function that wraps API requests with a token refresh mechanism to handle 401 Unauthorized errors.\\n\\n`handleSave`: A function that updates the user\\u0027s profile information by making a PUT request to the `/user/update` endpoint.\\n\\n`handleImageUpload`: A function that uploads a new profile image by making a POST request to the `/user/profile_image` endpoint.\\n\\n`handleImageDelete`: A function that deletes the user\\u0027s profile image by making a DELETE request to the `/user/profile_image` endpoint.\",\"/frontend/src/components/Songs.css\":\"This file contains CSS styles for a songs management application. It defines the styles for the songs container, the create song form, the songs list, and the selected song item. There are no functions defined in this file.\\n\\n`.songs-container`: Styles the container for the songs section.\\n`.create-song-form`: Styles the form for creating a new song.\\n`.songs-list`: Styles the list of songs.\\n`.songs-list li`: Styles each individual song item in the list.\\n`.songs-list li.selected`: Styles the selected song item in the list.\\n`.songs-list li button`: Styles the button for each song item.\",\"/frontend/src/components/Home.js\":\"This file contains a React component called `Home` that renders the home page of an audio creation application called AudioAnvil.\\n\\n`Home`: A React component that displays the home page of the AudioAnvil application, which includes a welcome message, a dashboard for authenticated users, and a login/signup prompt for unauthenticated users.\\n\\n`useNavigate`: A React Router hook that provides a function to navigate to different routes within the application.\",\"/frontend/src/index.js\":\"This file is the entry point for a React application. It sets up the root of the application and renders the `App` component within a `React.StrictMode` component. It also imports global styles and the `reportWebVitals` function, which can be used to measure the performance of the application.\\n\\n`ReactDOM.createRoot`: Creates a root for the React application and attaches it to the DOM element with the ID \\\"root\\\".\\n\\n`root.render`: Renders the `App` component within the `React.StrictMode` component, which helps identify potential issues in the application.\\n\\n`reportWebVitals`: A function that can be used to measure the performance of the application and report the results.\",\"/backend/config/firebase_config.json\":\"This file appears to be a JSON object containing the configuration details for a Google Cloud Platform service account. It does not contain any classes or functions. The file provides the necessary information for an application to authenticate and interact with Google Cloud services, such as Firebase, using the service account credentials.\",\"/frontend/src/components/EditLyrics.css\":\"This file contains CSS styles for an \\\"Edit Lyrics\\\" container, which includes styles for the container itself, the metadata information, success/error messages, the lyrics editor, and the preview of the edited lyrics.\\n\\n`.edit-lyrics-container`: Styles the main container for the \\\"Edit Lyrics\\\" section, including padding, max-width, and background styles.\\n\\n`.edit-lyrics-container h2`: Styles the heading within the \\\"Edit Lyrics\\\" container, including the color and alignment.\\n\\n`.metadata-info`: Styles the container for the metadata information, including the background color and padding.\\n\\n`.metadata-info p`: Styles the paragraphs within the metadata information container.\\n\\n`.success-message`: Styles the success message displayed when the lyrics are successfully edited.\\n\\n`.error-message`: Styles the error message displayed when there is an issue editing the lyrics.\\n\\n`.editor`: Styles the container for the lyrics editor.\\n\\n`.lyrics-textarea`: Styles the textarea where the user can edit the lyrics.\\n\\n`.editor-actions`: Styles the container for the editor action buttons (Save and Cancel).\\n\\n`.editor-actions button`: Styles the individual editor action buttons.\\n\\n`.lyrics-preview`: Styles the container for the preview of the edited lyrics.\\n\\n`.lyrics-preview pre`: Styles the pre-formatted text within the lyrics preview.\\n\\n`.edit-button`: Styles the button that allows the user to edit the lyrics.\",\"/frontend/src/components/Profile.css\":\"This file contains CSS styles for a user profile container, including styles for the header, success/error messages, user information section, input fields, buttons, and profile image section. There are no classes or functions defined in this file. The file provides a consistent and visually appealing layout and styling for a user profile page.\",\"/frontend/src/components/Login.js\":\"This file is a React component that handles the login functionality for a web application. It uses the `useState` hook to manage the state of the login form, and the `useNavigate` hook from the `react-router-dom` library to handle navigation. The component also uses the `axios` library to make an HTTP POST request to the server for authentication.\\n\\n`Login`: This component renders a login form and handles the login process, including form validation, API request, and error handling.\\n\\n`handleSubmit`: This function is called when the login form is submitted. It performs the login process, including making an API request and handling the response.\",\"/frontend/src/utils/apiClient.js\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it sets up an Axios instance with a base URL and a content type header, and then adds an interceptor to the Axios instance to handle 401 errors and refresh tokens. The interceptor checks if the error response has a 401 status code and a \\\"Token has expired\\\" message. If so, it attempts to refresh the token using the refresh token stored in local storage. If the token refresh is successful, it updates the access token in local storage and the Axios instance\\u0027s authorization header, and then retries the failed request. If the token refresh fails, it clears the tokens from local storage and redirects the user to the login page.\",\"/frontend/package.json\":\"This file appears to be a `package.json` file, which is a configuration file for a Node.js project. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather lists the dependencies, scripts, and other settings for the project.\\n\\nThe file sets up a React.js project with various dependencies, including testing libraries, utility libraries, and browser-specific libraries. It also configures the project to use the `craco` (Create React App Configuration Override) tool for building and running the application, and sets up a proxy to a local server running on port 5000.\\n\\nOverall, this file sets up the basic configuration and dependencies for a React.js-based frontend application.\",\"/frontend/src/setupTests.js\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is importing the `jest-dom` library, which adds custom Jest matchers for asserting on DOM nodes. This allows the developer to perform more specific and expressive assertions on DOM elements during testing, such as checking for the presence of certain text content or attributes.\",\"/backend/app.py\":\"This file is a Flask application that provides an API for user authentication, user profile management, lyrics generation, and song management. It also includes routes for generating default user avatars and managing user profile images. The application uses Firestore as the database and OpenAI for generating lyrics.\\n\\n`validate_email`: Validates the format of an email address.\\n`validate_password`: Validates the strength of a password.\\n`generate_chords`: Generates chord progressions based on a given theme and mood.\\n`create_default_image`: Generates a default avatar image based on the user\\u0027s initials.\\n`update_user`: Updates the user\\u0027s profile information, including username, email, and password.\\n`generate_initial_avatar`: Generates a default avatar image based on the user\\u0027s username.\\n`manage_profile_image`: Handles the upload, retrieval, and deletion of a user\\u0027s profile image.\\n`generate_lyrics`: Generates lyrics based on the provided theme, mood, genre, and other parameters.\\n`delete_lyrics`: Deletes a user\\u0027s generated lyrics.\\n`get_lyrics_history`: Retrieves the user\\u0027s generated lyrics history.\\n`update_lyric`: Updates a user\\u0027s generated lyrics.\\n`get_songs`: Retrieves the user\\u0027s saved songs.\\n`get_song`: Retrieves a specific song by its ID.\\n`manage_song`: Updates or deletes a user\\u0027s saved song.\\n`refresh_token`: Refreshes the user\\u0027s access token.\\n`signup`: Handles user registration.\\n`login`: Handles user authentication and token generation.\\n`generate_chords_route`: Generates chord progressions based on the provided theme and mood.\",\"/frontend/src/App.css\":\"This file contains CSS styles for an application. It does not have any classes or functions, but rather defines the overall styles for the application, including the layout, buttons, and links.\\n\\n`.app-container`: Defines the main container for the application, with a column-based layout and a gradient background.\\n\\n`.content-container`: Defines the container for the main content of the application, with a maximum width and centered layout.\\n\\n`button`: Defines the styles for the general buttons used in the application, including a gradient background, rounded corners, and hover effects.\\n\\n`button.outline`: Defines the styles for the outline button variant, with a transparent background and a colored border.\\n\\n`a`: Defines the styles for the links used in the application, including a color transition and hover effect.\\n\\nOverall, this file sets the visual style and layout for the application, providing a consistent and modern look and feel.\",\"/frontend/public/manifest.json\":\"This file appears to be a JSON configuration file for a React application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the metadata and configuration settings for the application. Here\\u0027s a summary of the file:\\n\\n`\\\"short_name\\\"`: Provides a short name for the application.\\n`\\\"name\\\"`: Provides the full name of the application.\\n`\\\"icons\\\"`: Defines the icons to be used for the application, including a favicon and two different sizes of the application logo.\\n`\\\"start_url\\\"`: Specifies the starting URL for the application.\\n`\\\"display\\\"`: Indicates that the application should be displayed in standalone mode.\\n`\\\"theme_color\\\"`: Specifies the theme color for the application.\\n`\\\"background_color\\\"`: Specifies the background color for the application.\\n\\nThis file is typically used by the Create React App tool to configure the metadata and settings for a React application, such as the application name, icons, and display settings.\",\"/backend/routes/drafts.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`save_draft`: Saves a draft to the Firestore database, including the title, lyrics, and chords, and returns the document ID.\\n\\n`get_drafts`: Retrieves all drafts from the Firestore database and returns a list of dictionaries containing the draft details, including the ID, title, lyrics, chords, and timestamp.\\n\\nThe file also creates a Flask Blueprint called `drafts_bp` that defines the routes for the drafts API.\",\"/frontend/src/index.css\":\"This file contains CSS styles for a web page. It does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it sets the default styles for the `body` and `code` elements.\\n\\n`body`: Resets the margin to 0, sets the font family, and enables font smoothing.\\n\\n`code`: Sets the font family for code elements.\",\"/backend/routes/lyrics.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`generate_lyrics`: Generates lyrics using OpenAI\\u0027s latest client interface, validates the input parameters, and saves the generated lyrics to Firestore.\\n\\n`export_txt`: Exports the generated lyrics as a text file.\\n\\n`export_pdf`: Exports the generated lyrics as a PDF file.\\n\\nThe file also sets up a Flask blueprint for the \\\"lyrics\\\" module, which provides the above-mentioned functionality.\",\"/frontend/src/components/Chords.js\":\"This file is a React component called `Chords` that allows users to generate a chord progression with a melody, export it as a MIDI file, and import MIDI and audio files. Here are the functions in the file:\\n\\n`parseChordName`: Parses a chord name string and returns an object with the root note and chord quality.\\n\\n`generateChordNotes`: Generates a list of notes for a given chord root and quality.\\n\\n`invertChord`: Inverts a list of chord notes by a specified number of inversions.\\n\\n`stringToUint8Array`: Converts a string to a Uint8Array.\\n\\n`generateChords`: Fetches a chord progression from an API based on a given key and mood, and updates the state.\\n\\n`downloadMidi`: Generates a MIDI file with a chord progression, bass line, and melody, and allows the user to download it.\\n\\n`handleMidiImport`: Handles the import of a MIDI file and updates the state.\\n\\n`handleAudioUpload`: Handles the upload of an audio file and updates the state.\",\"/frontend/src/components/LyricsHistory.css\":\"This file appears to be a CSS stylesheet that defines the styles for a lyrics history container and its related elements. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a set of CSS rules that control the appearance and behavior of the various components within the container. The key elements and their summaries are as follows:\\n\\n`.lyrics-history-container`: A container that holds the lyrics history, with a gradient background, rounded corners, and a drop shadow.\\n\\n`h2`: The heading for the lyrics history, with a centered alignment, orange color, and text shadow.\\n\\n`.error-message`: A message displayed when there is an error, with a red color and bouncing animation.\\n\\n`.no-lyrics`: A message displayed when there are no lyrics, with a gray color and italic font.\\n\\n`.lyrics-list`: A container that holds the individual lyrics items, displayed in a vertical column.\\n\\n`.lyrics-item`: An individual lyrics item, with a gradient background, rounded corners, and a drop shadow, and a hover effect.\\n\\n`.lyrics-actions`: A container for the buttons that allow the user to interact with the lyrics item.\\n\\n`.edit-form`: A form for editing the lyrics, with a gradient background and drop shadow.\\n\\n`.edit-fields`: The input fields within the edit form, with a dark background and focus effect.\\n\\n`.edit-actions`: The buttons within the edit form, with a gradient background and hover effect.\\n\\nThe file also includes several CSS animations, such as `fadeIn`, `slideIn`, `fadeInUp`, and `bounceIn`, which are used to add visual effects to the various elements.\",\"/frontend/src/components/Navbar.js\":\"This file contains a React component called `Navbar` that renders a navigation bar with various links and a user profile dropdown. The component uses several hooks, including `useState`, `useEffect`, and `useRef`, to manage the state and behavior of the navbar.\\n\\n`Navbar`: A React component that renders a navigation bar with links, a user profile dropdown, and authentication buttons.\\n\\n`useState`: A hook used to manage the state of the user profile and the dropdown menu.\\n\\n`useEffect`: A hook used to fetch the user\\u0027s avatar image and update the user profile state.\\n\\n`useRef`: A hook used to create a reference to the dropdown menu element to handle click events outside the dropdown.\\n\\n`useNavigate`: A hook used to navigate to different routes within the application.\\n\\n`toggleDropdown`: A function that toggles the visibility of the user profile dropdown menu.\\n\\n`closeDropdown`: A function that closes the user profile dropdown menu when a click event occurs outside the dropdown.\",\"/frontend/src/components/LyricsForm.js\":\"This file contains a React component called `LyricsForm` that allows users to generate song lyrics based on various input parameters such as theme, mood, genre, rhyme scheme, maximum length, and creativity level. The component also saves the generated lyrics to a history.\\n\\n`LyricsForm`: A React component that provides a form for users to input various parameters to generate song lyrics and save the generated lyrics to a history.\\n\\n`handleInputChange`: A function that updates the form data state when the user changes an input field.\\n\\n`handleSubmit`: A function that handles the form submission, generates the lyrics, and saves the generated lyrics to a history.\",\"/frontend/src/styles.css\":\"This file appears to be a CSS stylesheet that defines the styles for a web application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a set of styles for various elements and components of the application. Here\\u0027s a summary of the main styles in the file:\\n\\n`body`: Resets the default styles for the body element and sets the font, background color, and text color.\\n\\n`.App`: Centers the content of the application within a maximum width of 800 pixels.\\n\\n`button`: Styles the buttons used throughout the application, including hover effects.\\n\\n`form`: Styles the forms used in the application, including the layout, spacing, and input fields.\\n\\n`.lyrics-container`: Styles the container for displaying generated lyrics, including the pre-formatted text.\\n\\n`.home-container`, `.auth-prompt`, `.quick-actions`, `.quick-links`: Styles the home page and authentication-related components.\\n\\n`.recent-activity`: Styles the list of recent activity items.\\n\\n`.lyrics-form-container`, `.edit-form`, `.lyrics-output`: Styles the lyrics form and output components.\\n\\n`.error-message`: Styles the error message display.\\n\\n`.navbar`: Styles the navigation bar, including the logo, links, and user-related elements.\\n\\n`.lyrics-history-container`: Styles the lyrics history page.\\n\\n`#dashboard`: Styles the new dashboard section, including the header, lyric preview, chord diagrams, and song arranger.\",\"/frontend/src/components/Home.css\":\"This file contains CSS styles for a web page with a home container, hero section, quick actions section, songbook section, and various other elements. There are no classes or functions defined in this file. The file sets the layout, colors, and animations for the different sections of the web page.\",\"/frontend/src/components/Login.css\":\"This file contains CSS styles for a login container and form. It does not contain any classes or functions. The file sets the styles for the login container, form elements, and error messages to create a visually appealing and responsive login interface.\",\"/frontend/src/components/Signup.js\":\"This file is a React component that implements a signup form with frontend validation and backend communication using Axios.\\n\\n`Signup`: A React functional component that renders a signup form, handles form state, performs frontend validation, and sends the form data to the backend using Axios.\\n\\n`handleChange`: A function that updates the form data state when the user types in the input fields.\\n\\n`handleSubmit`: A function that is called when the user submits the form. It performs frontend validation, sends the form data to the backend, and updates the success or error message state.\\n\\n`validateEmail`: A function that validates the email address entered by the user.\\n\\n`validatePassword`: A function that validates the password entered by the user.\",\"/frontend/src/components/Chords.css\":\"This file contains CSS styles for a React component called \\\"Chords\\\". The styles define the layout and appearance of the component, which appears to be a MIDI integration interface with sections for exporting, importing, and audio-related functionality. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the styles for various elements within the component.\\n\\nThe main styles defined in this file are:\\n\\n`.midi-integration`: Styles the main container for the MIDI integration interface.\\n`.midi-integration h2`: Styles the main heading of the interface.\\n`.export-section`, `.import-section`, `.audio-section`: Styles the individual sections of the interface.\\n`.export-section h3`, `.import-section h3`, `.audio-section h3`: Styles the headings for the individual sections.\\n`.midi-integration p`: Styles the paragraphs of text within the interface.\\n`.action-button`: Styles the buttons used for various actions within the interface.\\n`.error-message`: Styles the error messages that may be displayed within the interface.\\n`.import-section input`, `.audio-section input`: Styles the file input elements within the import and audio sections.\",\"/frontend/README.md\":\"This file is a documentation for the Create React App project, which is a popular tool for setting up a React development environment. It provides an overview of the available scripts and their functionalities, as well as information about code splitting, bundle size analysis, progressive web app development, advanced configuration, deployment, and troubleshooting. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather serves as a guide for developers who are getting started with Create React App.\",\"/backend/utils/ai_helpers.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following function:\\n\\n`generate_prompt`: This function takes in three parameters (theme, mood, and genre) and returns a formatted string that can be used as a prompt for generating a song about the given theme, mood, and genre.\",\"/frontend/src/components/Footer.js\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following function:\\n\\n`Footer`: This function returns a React component that renders a footer with a copyright notice and links to the About, Privacy Policy, and Terms of Service pages.\",\"/Contact.java\":\"This file defines a `Contact` class that represents a contact with a name and a phone number. The class provides methods to get and set the name and phone number, as well as methods to compare and hash contacts.\\n\\n`Contact`: A class that represents a contact with a name and a phone number.\\n\\n`getName()`: Returns the name of the contact.\\n`setName()`: Sets the name of the contact.\\n`getPhone()`: Returns the phone number of the contact.\\n`setPhone()`: Sets the phone number of the contact.\\n`toString()`: Returns a string representation of the contact.\\n`equals()`: Compares two contacts for equality based on their name and phone number.\\n`hashCode()`: Returns a hash code for the contact based on its name and phone number.\",\"/frontend/src/components/LyricsDisplay.js\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`exportLyrics`: This function sends a POST request to the server to export the generated lyrics in either TXT or PDF format, and then creates a download link for the user to download the file.\\n\\n`LyricsDisplay`: This functional component renders the generated lyrics and provides buttons for the user to export the lyrics in TXT or PDF format.\\n\\nThe file is a React component that displays the generated lyrics and provides functionality to export the lyrics in different formats.\",\"/backend/routes/__init__.py\":\"There are no classes or functions in the provided document. The document appears to be an empty XML document with a `\\u003cdocument\\u003e` and `\\u003c/document\\u003e` tag.\",\"/frontend/src/App.js\":\"This file is the main entry point of a React application that handles routing and state management. It does not contain any classes, but it has the following functions:\\n\\n`useState`: Manages the state of the token and user in the application.\\n`useEffect`: Logs the changes in the token and user state to the console.\\n`handleLogin`: Updates the token and user state and stores them in the local storage.\\n`handleLogout`: Removes the token and user from the local storage and resets the state.\\n`App`: The main component that renders the Navbar, Routes, and Footer components, and handles the routing and state management for the application.\\n\\nThe file imports various components, such as Navbar, Login, Signup, Home, LyricsForm, LyricsHistory, Songs, Profile, Footer, and Chords, and sets up the routing for the application using the React Router library.\",\"/frontend/src/components/Signup.css\":\"This file contains CSS styles for a sign-up form. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the styles for various elements of the form, such as the container, form, labels, inputs, buttons, and success/error messages.\\n\\n`.signup-container`: Styles the container for the sign-up form, including its maximum width, margin, padding, background, border radius, and box shadow.\\n\\n`.signup-form`: Styles the sign-up form, including the display, flex direction, and gap between form elements.\\n\\n`label`: Styles the labels for the form inputs, including the font weight and margin.\\n\\n`input`: Styles the form inputs, including the padding, font size, border, and border radius.\\n\\n`button`: Styles the submit button, including the padding, font size, color, background, border, border radius, cursor, and hover transition.\\n\\n`.success-message`: Styles the success message, including the color and font weight.\\n\\n`.error-message`: Styles the error message, including the color and font weight.\",\"/frontend/src/components/LyricsForm.css\":\"This file contains CSS styles for a form-based application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the styles for various elements of the form and its layout. Here\\u0027s a summary of the key styles:\\n\\n`.lyrics-form-container`: Styles the main container for the form, including a gradient background, rounded corners, and a drop shadow.\\n\\n`h2`: Styles the main heading of the form, including a centered layout, color, font size, and text shadow.\\n\\n`.lyrics-form`: Styles the layout of the form, using a vertical flex-direction.\\n\\n`.form-group`: Styles the individual form groups, including the label and input/select elements.\\n\\n`label`: Styles the labels for the form inputs.\\n\\n`.description`: Styles the description text below the form inputs.\\n\\n`input`, `select`: Styles the form inputs and selects, including background color, font, and focus styles.\\n\\n`input[type\\u003d\\\"range\\\"]`: Styles the temperature slider input, including the gradient background and thumb styles.\\n\\n`.temperature-value`: Styles the temperature value display.\\n\\n`.error-message`: Styles the error message display.\\n\\n`.generate-button`: Styles the form\\u0027s \\\"Generate\\\" button, including hover and disabled states.\\n\\n`.lyrics-output`: Styles the output area for the generated lyrics, including a gradient background and monospace font.\\n\\n`.lyrics-output h3`: Styles the heading within the lyrics output.\\n\\nThe file also includes several CSS animations to add visual interest and feedback to the form.\",\"/README.md\":\"This file appears to be a documentation for a songwriting companion app called AudioAnvil. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather provides an overview of the app\\u0027s features and setup instructions. The key points are:\\n\\n1. AudioAnvil is a songwriting companion app that helps musicians generate lyrics, suggest chord progressions, and save drafts for their songs.\\n\\n2. The app\\u0027s features include AI-powered lyric generation, chord progression suggestions, and the ability to save, organize, and export song drafts.\\n\\n3. The setup instructions cover the backend setup, which involves navigating to the `backend/` folder and installing the required dependencies using `pip install -r requirements.txt`.\",\"/frontend/package-lock.json\":\"This file appears to be a configuration file for a React project using the `@craco/craco` library. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines various dependencies, plugins, and settings for the project. The file sets up the project\\u0027s build and development environment, including the use of Autoprefixer, Cosmiconfig, and other tools to manage the project\\u0027s CSS and other assets.\",\"/frontend/src/components/LyricsHistory.js\":\"This file is a React component called `LyricsHistory` that displays the user\\u0027s lyrics history, allows editing of lyrics, and provides the ability to delete lyrics. Here\\u0027s a summary of the classes and functions in the file:\\n\\n`LyricsHistory`: A React component that fetches and displays the user\\u0027s lyrics history, allows editing of lyrics, and provides the ability to delete lyrics.\\n\\n`fetchLyricsHistory`: A function that fetches the user\\u0027s lyrics history from the API and updates the component\\u0027s state.\\n\\n`handleDelete`: A function that deletes a specific lyrics entry from the user\\u0027s history and updates the component\\u0027s state accordingly.\",\"/frontend/src/reportWebVitals.js\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`reportWebVitals`: This function is responsible for reporting web vitals, which are a set of metrics that measure the performance of a web page. It imports the necessary functions from the `web-vitals` library and calls them with the provided `onPerfEntry` function as a callback.\\n\\nThe file exports the `reportWebVitals` function, which can be used to track and report web vitals in a web application.\"}"}
